title: REDUCED: c1911 RPPC - Tony Faeth (Fairmont uniform)
author: h2oya311

posts.post_title: REDUCED: c1911 RPPC - Tony Faeth (Fairmont uniform)
posts.post_content:
Up for sale is an interesting RPPC of Tony Faeth, early in his baseball playing career.  He is pictured in his semi-pro team uniform (Fairmont) c1911.  The back of the postcard has several publication markings.  Included will be a return letter/envelope from the publication back to Tony from 1941.

Take a look at Tony's SABR bio here:
[url]https://sabr.org/bioproj/person/tony-faeth/[/url]

From what I can see, he was an interesting character, particularly off the baseball field, having bested Dave "Beauty" Bancroft in a billiards match and boxing other major leaguers.  While with the St. Paul Saints, he was  instrumental in winning the pennant in the 1924 American Association, finishing with a 15-4 record, and was a key contributor in the championship games against the Baltimore Orioles in the Little World Series.  He even squared off against Lefty Grove during the Little World Series.

Faeth did get a small taste of the big leagues in 1919 and 1920, pitching for the Cleveland Indians.

Asking [S]$95[/S] $75 net to me.  Shipping is on me.  PM or email me at [url]h2oya311@yahoo.com[/url] if interested.
